datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to submerged artifacts, shipwrecks, and sunken cities.

columns.name: ocean_current_strength
columns.description: Measurement of ocean current strength at the site in knots

columns.name: light_penetration
columns.description: Percentage of light that penetrates to the site, measured as a percentage

columns.name: sediment_concentration
columns.description: Amount of sediment in the water measured in grams per liter

columns.name: site_discovery_date
columns.description: Date when the archaeological site was discovered

columns.name: number_of_artifacts
columns.description: Number of artifacts recovered from the site

columns.name: depth_of_site
columns.description: Measure of depth at which the archaeological site is located, in meters

columns.name: current_speed
columns.description: Speed of the water current at the site, measured in meters per second

columns.name: stone_structures_present
columns.description: Indicates whether stone structures are present at the site

columns.name: preserved_road_layout
columns.description: Indicates if the archaeological site has preserved road layouts

columns.name: permit_year
columns.description: Year when the excavation permit for the site was issued

columns.name: protected_marine_area
columns.description: Indicates whether the site is within a legally protected marine conservation area

columns.name: water_depth
columns.description: Depth of water at the site in meters

columns.name: site_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for each archaeological site

columns.name: sediment_accumulation_rate
columns.description: Rate of sediment accumulation at the site in kilograms per square meter per year

queries.question: Is there a relationship between the presence of stone structures along with specific oceanic and site conditions and the existence of preserved road layouts at underwater archaeological sites?
queries.true_hypothesis: In locations where the combination of ocean current strength, the existence of a protected marine area with low sediment accumulation rate, and specific site depth considerations are met along with stone structures present, preserved road layouts are indicated with 'yes' at underwater archaeological sites.
